benchmark_details.name: TypeEvalPy: A Micro-benchmarking Framework for Python Type Inference Tools
benchmark_details.overview: This paper evaluates the application of Large Language Models (LLMs) in static analysis tasks on Python programs using micro-benchmarks for call graph analysis and type inference.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate the role of LLMs in improving call graph analysis and type inference in static analysis.

methodology.calculation: Evaluated metrics based on the number of true positives and false positives in static analysis outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in identifying correct call graphs and type annotations.
methodology.validation: Evaluated results using multiple protocols to ensure reliability.
